TopicTitle: Leaving KSP... or at least for now...

Articles.Content:
I haven't actually been playing for a month or so. I am abandoning this account. Maybe I'll make a new one eventually.

KSP will still be one of my favorite games I've ever played, but sometimes I think I get too into it, maybe.

Sorry for filling the forums with useless threads.

 

Moderators, I think this is in the wrong subforum. Feel free to move it.
k. Isn't it against the rules to make multiple accounts?
I also left KSP and the forums for a few months.This game will suck you back like a magnet in a month or two.

Yeah, you won't be gone for long. Kerbin is actually a giant human magnet!

Seriously, sorry to see you go.

9 hours ago, ThatGuyWithALongUsername said:

I haven't actually been playing for a month or so. I am abandoning this account. Maybe I'll make a new one eventually.

KSP will still be one of my favorite games I've ever played, but sometimes I think I get too into it, maybe.

Sorry for filling the forums with useless threads.

 

Moderators, I think this is in the wrong subforum. Feel free to move it.

Abandoning after a month? Pfffft, I've just starting playing again after about a year, and the break before that was between 0.24 and 1.0, also about a year.

Find these sort of announcements a little depressing, its not like you're breaking up with KSP!

You'll be back
Yeah, I had to abandon the game to, it's just too unstable for me.

As other have said, you'll be back   I take a couple month breaks here and there, just started getting back into it recently.

 

You may think you've escaped... until you start seeing Kerbals everywhere.
What is up with all these people making a dramatic goodbye post? When did this become fashionable? If you feel you need to move on, do so.

On 5/28/2016 at 9:05 PM, Camacha said:

What is up with all these people making a dramatic goodbye post? When did this become fashionable? If you feel you need to move on, do so.

I figured most everyone plays in cycles.  I know I do.  Eventually I mod it till it breaks and wait a few updates (I skipped 1.0.5).  I actually fear getting burnt out (like seriously terrified, because I know it will come).  

There does seem to be alot of these goodbye posts.  A "protest" maybe?
I have played since I got the game on 0.23.5

On 5/27/2016 at 6:05 PM, Camacha said:

What is up with all these people making a dramatic goodbye post? When did this become fashionable? If you feel you need to move on, do so.

My guess is that they feel either:

1. Feel some sort of connection with the KSP community (even if the community doesn't actually share the same connection) and feel the need to say goodbye. I consider it a bit like leaving a job and saying goodbye through an email even though most of the people you may send that email to won't actually miss you. It provides a sense of closure to the OP.

2. They don't really feel a connection and are hoping that the slightly dramatic exit will warrant some exposure and attention that they are looking for.

4 minutes ago, Tex Mechs Robot said:

2. They don't really feel a connection and are hoping that the slightly dramatic exit will warrant some exposure and attention that they are looking for.

I am felling pretty pessimistic today, so I will assume it is the second option.

35 minutes ago, Camacha said:

I am felling pretty pessimistic today, so I will assume it is the second option.

In order to balance the force, I'll assume it's the first :-)
